fields_of_interest: Culture, International co-operation and development, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, External Relations
eu_initiatives: The WUC performs some lobbying activities in relation to the EU and European Parliament. In particular, the WUC meets with MEPs to update them on the deteriorating situation in the Uyghur Autonomous Region and push for European action to alleviate their situation. The WUC is focused on EU foreign policy, particularly its relations with China. We advocate for human rights to be fully integrated in the EU's relations with China and for the Uyghur issue to be raised.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
The WUC Congress is a member of the Unrepresented Nations and Peoples Organisation (UNPO). The Belgian contact address provided is UNPO's Belgian office, who we work with closely in our engagement with the EU. 
 
Website: http://unpo.org/members/7872
relevant_communication: The World Uyghur Congress works with the Unrepresented Nations and Peoples Organisation to implement its advocacy strategy in the institutions of the European Union. With the help of UNPO, a Uyghur friendship group was formed this past October (2017). With the group as a network for action, we intend to organise a number of conferences on specific human rights violations against Uyghurs and try to raise greater awareness of the situation of the Uyghur people.
goals__remit: The World Uyghur Congress (WUC) is an international organization based in Munich, Germany, that represents the collective interest of the Uyghur people both in East Turkestan (also known as the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region, Peoples Republic of China ‘PRC’) and abroad. The main objective of WUC is to promote the right of the Uyghur people to use peaceful, nonviolent, and democratic means to determine the political future of East Turkestan.
